sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The European Parliament has marked its 70th anniversary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: During its history, it has transformed from a coal and steel community to its current democratically elected body.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There's more trouble in store for the global economy, as the OECD's latest forecast predicts slower growth in the year ahead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Decades after its initial creation, leaders in Strasbourg marked the 70th anniversary

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: of the founding of the European Parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The landmark anniversary was led by the Parliament's president, Roberta Mazzola.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Good morning, dear colleagues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I am proud of our achievements, of our way, of Europe being a beacon of the defence of democracy, of the way that we have never been indifferent, of how we have never looked away.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Europe is the answer to so many of the questions our people ask of us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It is a way of life and a way of living. It was no coincidence that the EU flag was raised over Kherson after so many months of brutal occupation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It is because it symbolizes hope, courage and belief.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The current assembly, which sits in both Strasbourg and Brussels, grew out of the European coal and steel community's first meeting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It brought together national representatives appointed by European member states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The chamber later became the European Parliament, and since 1979 its members are elected by universal suffrage every five years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: years. The Ukrainian government has been offering people in the recently liberated city of Harrison which remains mostly without electricity and running water free evacuations to regions

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: with better infrastructure as well as free accommodation there. The southern front has been the recent focus of efforts for both Russian and Ukrainian forces before Ukraine has liberated the West Bank of Kherson, including the regional capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Now let's take a look at the last piece of territory that Russian forces occupy in the region of Mykolaiv, the Kinburn Spit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A Ukrainian official acknowledged that Ukrainian forces are conducting a military operation there. This is this area, a location which would allow Ukrainian forces to better conduct potential operations on the east bank in Kherson region. The Kinbur Spit is only four kilometers across the strait from Ochakiv and allows for control of the entrance to the Dnipro and southern Bug rivers, as well as the Mykolaiv and Kherson city ports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russian forces used positions on the Kinburn Spit to conduct routine missile and artillery strikes on Ukrainian positions in Ochakiv, southern Mykolaiv region, and other areas along the Ukrainian-controlled Black Sea coast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Now, control of the Kinbre spit would allow Ukrainian forces to relieve Russian strikes on the Ukrainian controlled Black Sea coast, increase naval activity in this area and conduct potential operations to cross to the east bank in Kherson region under significantly less Russian artillery fire compared to crossing the Dnipro River there. Along the east bank of Dnipro, Russian forces continue to strengthen their defense and build additional lines deep inside Russian-occupied territory from where, after their withdrawal, they keep attacking Ukrainian positions and shelling liberated areas, including the city of Kherson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There are troubled times ahead for the global economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In its latest forecast, the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development is predicting slower growth in the year ahead, with only slight recovery in 2024.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The West will be particularly affected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: GDP in the euro area and growth in the US are expected to decline to 0.5%. The global outlook is set at 2.2% and GDP is predicted to rebound to a modest 1.4% in Europe by 2024.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The OECD says Russia's war in Ukraine is the single biggest factor in the slowdown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The world is facing substantial headwinds and substantial risks over the horizon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In this challenging environment, we need to confront the crisis with well-designed policy responses as well as with international cooperation in order to overcome this difficult situation and pave the way for a better future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Soaring high inflation is dragging on economies around the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Its effect will only weaken slightly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In the euro area, inflation next year is expected to drop to 6.8% from this year's high.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: However, the incremental drop in prices in the US may continue, with inflation falling to 3.5. Inflationary pressures have really

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: intensified and became a lot more pervasive. And you can see that in many countries of the world, you have more than 50, 60, 70 percent of all goods and services of their economies that right now are growing more than 6 percent a year. So inflation has become more entrenched and intensified, but also more broad-based central banks are expected to maintain high interest rates to combat inflation which is largely fueled by soaring energy costs caused by President Putin's war as far as the OECD is concerned economies will remain vulnerable to further shocks and even a deepening energy crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: China is facing what authorities are calling its most severe COVID test as it records its

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: first deaths in six months. Three people died in Beijing over the weekend, bringing the country's official death toll to more than 5,200. The latest fatalities have plunged parts of the city back into lockdown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: China is the last major economy still sticking to a no-tolerance policy on the virus and has enforced snap lockdowns, mass testing and quarantines as the rest of the world adjusts to living with COVID.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Colombia's government and the leftist National Liberation Army have resumed formal talks in Venezuela for the first time since they were suspended in 2019.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The ELN is the last recognized rebel group in the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The talks are a push by President Gustav Petro, who in August became Colombia's first ever leftist leader and has vowed to end violence by armed groups. In a joint statement, the parties have agreed to resume the dialogue process with full political and ethical will.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: There was agony and ecstasy in Qatar as Saudi Arabia pulled off a major World Cup upset

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: to beat Argentina 2-1 in the opening game of Group C. Two-time world champions Argentina had looked set to make it 37 games unbeaten when a Lionel Messi penalty gave the South Americans an early lead. But in the second half, Saudi Arabia came out fighting, netting twice in just 10 minutes to turn the game on its head. Argentina couldn't mount a comeback and the Saudis held on for a famous win.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Legendary Cuban singer-songwriter Pablo Milanes has died at the age of 79.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: According to his representatives, Milanes was hospitalised in Madrid after falling ill in the Spanish capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He had been undergoing treatment for cancer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Milanes was the founder of Nueva Trova, an emerging genre of music in the 60s, just after the Cuban Revolution of 1959.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Inspired by protest songs from America's civil rights movement, Nueva Trova combines storytelling with folk music to communicate Cuba's social problems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As a result, he was lauded as a cultural icon during Fidel Castro's reign, incorporating politics into his music alongside musicians Silvio Rodriguez and Noel Nicola.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In his early years, Milanese began his career singing on local radio and television contests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In early November, he was forced to cancel concerts due to his deteriorating health.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Rural Donegal in the northwest of Ireland, a place home to wetlands that store peat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Across the nation, one in seven households still rely on turf to heat their homes. The Irish government, however, seeks to cut down peat cutting as part of its climate plans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But that move has been met with resistance amid soaring energy costs. The Irish government, however, seeks to cut down peat cutting as part of its climate plans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But that move has been met with resistance amid soaring energy costs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Livestock farmer Mickey O'Donnell used to cut peat for a living.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He sees peat as a way to keep costs down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And 200 a year, you mean, and this is what it cost me for the whole winter?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Yeah, the whole winter, yeah.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That's it?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And the summer, yeah.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Yeah? Wow. So, with the current energy prices, this is still affordable?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Very, very cheap.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: If you do the work yourself, it's a lot cheaper.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Bogs where peat is stored are also a vital source for capturing carbon from the air.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And if left alone, it can be stored for thousands of years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But once removed from the ground, that gain is lost.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Green Party are spearheading a ban on commercial peat sales.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: MP Marco Kosasig says that he wants to be allies with peat cutters.
